title: Calories in Ground Beef Cooked
meta_description: Discover calories in ground beef cooked per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, pan-broiled and drained, no added seasonings or oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by leanness, cooking method, draining, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~246 kcal and ~26 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 246 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in cooked ground beef?
Does cooking method affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling or broiling without draining adds calories from retained fat.

faqs.q: How does leanness impact calories in ground beef cooked?
faqs.a: Leaner (90%) has ~186 kcal per 100 g; fattier (70%) up to 300 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in ground beef cooked?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars—pure protein and fat source.
